intro: Vernonia phanerophlebia, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and robust. Vernonia phanerophlebia plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity.
